item.title: August Endings
item.description:
Just about winding down from the long weekend. Last week at work was super productive but also left me pretty drained by Friday. Working in a smaller shop comes with its perks but also brings in all the logistic hurdles. I’m guessing most of it is also got to do with us being in Africa. Travel logistics are a pain and the amount of admin overhead for getting actual stuff done is beyond bonkers. Decision memos, note-verbale’s, single entry visas, travel ticketing - always something that needs to be followed up on…

Family back in the states decided to rent a cabin in the Catskills and get some downtime. With photos coming in all weekend, definitely missed being there. Last time we did this in 2022, it was a 50 odd group and we had such a good time overall. One of those moments when you feel this is the tax you end up paying for choosing this career.

Exited a couple family WA groups that I’d joined in June/July to manage the air-ambulance for mummyjaan. Getting people off this wretched network is such a pain. I’m trying to find a decent interim - use it where absolutely necessary and GTFO as soon as the work is done. Feels like I’m beating the same drum to a deaf audience but I will stand my ground on this shit. Currently I have the app installed in my ‘work profile’ on my personal phone and turn it on only when really necessary.

Made some decent decisions on the financial front. With some liquidity, I think we now have a game-plan for some investments. Playing the long-game does seem to be making returns.

Took some time this weekend to upgrade my Trilium instance to the ‘Next’ version. Upgrade was painless. Major kudos to the new bunch of folks maintaining this real neat notes software. I do need to update a bunch of my notes here. Always an ongoing process! ðŸ”—

item.title: Febe loop
item.description:
Wasn’t quite a run, but was some good time outdoors. Last night M suggested I head out for a run the next day since the weather has been really good - overcast and quite breezy. This morning though, the sky was super clear and it felt relatively hotter than usual. Decided to still head out and so glad I did!

Besides taking all the ‘offshoot’ roads, I also ended up doing the whole loop. On the way downhill, besides a few stares here and there, it did feel decently safe. I did consciously get my earphones off though- just to be extra aware of my surroundings.

Feels good to be back on the roads after a couple months. ðŸ”—

item.title: Malabo north paseo
item.description:
Amazed at how well this ‘Paseo’ is maintained! We were here in the morning on a weekend and there was barely anybody here. Word is also that this area is not really frequented by locals. Not even during the evenings. Wonder why though? This country’s got SO MUCH potential. The infrastructure is really good. Would be barely surprised if all of this is managed by a Chinese contracted firm. Definitely something to say about the merits of foreign influence.
